info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 3:33AM CDT until June 26 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Buffalo, Franklin, Harlan and Kearney.
* WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possible flooding along small creeks/streams and rural roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated widespread light to moderate rain across the Advisory area. Although the very-heaviest rain from earlier in the night has since ended, at least localized/minor flooding issues will likely continue for at least a few more hours due to widespread 1 to 4 inches of earlier rain, and the potential for another roughly one-half inch of rain before precipitation finally ends by around 5 or 6 AM. Flooding of several small creeks/streams and mainly rural county roads could continue early this morning. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Alma, Franklin, Hildreth, Wilcox, Republican City, Naponee, Bloomington, Huntley and Harlan County Dam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Buffalo, NE; Franklin, NE; Harlan, NE; Kearney, NE
